Class MillsColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • MillsColor

  • public class MillsColor
extends java.lang.Object
    Test 1B
    Author:
    Ellen Spertus [Replace with your Mills ID]

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MillsColor(int red, int green, int blue)
      Constructs a new instance with the given color component values, which are passed through boundColorComponent(int) to ensure that they are in the range 0 to 255, inclusive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MillsColor

        public MillsColor(int red,
                  int green,
                  int blue)
        Constructs a new instance with the given color component values, which are passed through boundColorComponent(int) to ensure that they are in the range 0 to 255, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        red - the red color component
        green - the green color component
        blue - the blue color component

    • Method Detail

      • inRange

        protected static boolean inRange(int component)
        Tests whether the color component is in the range 0 to 255, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        component - a color component
        Returns:
        true if in the range 0 to 255, inclusive; false otherwise

      • setRed

        public void setRed(int red)
        Sets this color's red component to the argument, if it is in range, as determined by inRange(int). If it is not in range, no change is made.
        Parameters:
        red - the new red component

      • setGreen

        public void setGreen(int green)
        Sets this color's green component to the argument, if it is in range, as determined by inRange(int). If it is not in range, no change is made.
        Parameters:
        green - the new green component

      • setBlue

        public void setBlue(int blue)
        Sets this color's blue component to the argument, if it is in range, as determined by inRange(int). If it is not in range, no change is made.
        Parameters:
        blue - the new blue component

      • boundColorComponent

        protected static int boundColorComponent(int i)
        Ensures that a color component is within the range [0, 255]. Specifically, if the parameter is greater than 255, the return value is 255; if the parameter is less than 0, the return value is 0; otherwise, the return value is the parameter.
        Parameters:
        i - a numeric color component value
        Returns:
        a component value in the range 0 to 255, inclusive

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this color of the form "(r, g, b)", where r, g, and b are the red, green, and blue color components, respectively. For example, if the red component was 5, the green component 10, and the blue component 20, the string representation would be "(5, 10, 20)".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the color

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Tests whether this color is equal to the argument. This will be the case if and only if the argument is also a MillsColor with the same three component values.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if they have the same component values, false otherwise

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays a window whose background color is this color and whose text is the value returned by toString(). The implementation of this method is provided for you.

      • testEqualsMethod

        protected static void testEqualsMethod()
        Tests the method equals(Object) by creating 3 instances and testing them for equality. It should be clear from the printed output what three colors were created and which pairs of colors were found to be equal.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Repeatedly prompts user to provide red, green, and blue color component values, which are used to create a new instance of this class, which is printed and displayed. This does no error checking. The program ends after the user enters a color with a negative component value.
        Parameters:
        args - ignored
